dict.string:
April 2014 pre-course notes IV Lists are special type of vector that can obtain elements of different classes. They very important data type in R and you should get to know them very well. To view all the objects created in this R session,use the 'list function: > ls() To remove an individual object from the current working environment (a in this care), use the following command: > rm(a) Objects can be removed by nestling the ls() function within the rm() function. THIS IS NOT UNDOABLE!!! > rm(list=ls())
Since you can put a variety of things inside a list, that are not of the same class you can see this demonstrated below: The results of a list will show up with a double bracket [[x]]
